result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc Lee Manderfield

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Do not drive at all. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.   Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM on the day of your release/court appearance.  Weekend or night releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am - 4:30 pm)  **NOTE: A $210 advance fee for installment of the SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.** Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:39 PM Defendant Marc Lee Manderfield in court, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  btc; Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.


Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
